carousel_items: Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Reclast is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Reclast is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but you have to see a doctor to get each dose.
downsides: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

upsides: You only have to take this once a year.

upsides_processed.orig: You only have to take this once a year.

userStories.tip: After IV injection had severe inflammatory reaction for 3 days, bed ridden with chills, high fever and severe muscle and bone pains

drugs.name: Reclast

carousel_items_processed.orig: Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Reclast.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Reclast.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Can be taken as a tablet or as an intravenous infusion.
Take the tablet first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of plain water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 60 minutes after you've taken the tablet.
Stay sitting or standing, and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 60 minutes after you take the tablet until you've had your first food of the day.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Take the 150 mg tablet on the same day every month.
If you forget to take the 150mg tablet on your chosen day each month, take it on the next day in the morning.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
Some of these medications are only taken once a month, others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

basics.benefits_moa: Boniva is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Boniva is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but how you have to take it can be a hassle. It's also only approved for women, not men.
downsides: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 60 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.
Only approved to treat and prevent osteoporosis in women who have gone through menopause.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 60 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.
Only approved to treat and prevent osteoporosis in women who have gone through menopause.

upsides: Available in oral tablets that can be given once a month or once a day.
Also available as shot given into your vein every 3 months.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in oral tablets that can be given once a month or once a day.
Also available as shot given into your vein every 3 months.

userStories.tip: Muscle aches, joint pain, 4 finger joints swelled, fever, headache.  I could barely walk to the kitchen and bathroom.  Took 10 tries to get up out of the chair.

drugs.name: Boniva

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can be taken as a tablet or as an intravenous infusion.
Take the tablet first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of plain water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 60 minutes after you've taken the tablet.
Stay sitting or standing, and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 60 minutes after you take the tablet until you've had your first food of the day.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Take the 150 mg tablet on the same day every month.
If you forget to take the 150mg tablet on your chosen day each month, take it on the next day in the morning.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
Some of these medications are only taken once a month, others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

risks_warnings.title: Irritation and ulcers to the stomach and esophagus
risks_warnings.description: People on the oral version of Boniva have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

description_processed.orig: People on the oral version of Boniva have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Boniva.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Boniva.

risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.
